data_units.question: What do MB and GB mean?
data_units.answer: MB (Megabytes) and GB (Gigabytes) are units of data. 1 GB = 1,024 MB. Most modern apps use several MB per hour of use.

save_data.question: How can I save data while traveling?
save_data.answer: Use Wi-Fi when available, download maps offline, disable auto-play videos, and use data-saving modes in apps.

international_travel.question: How much mobile data do I need for international travel?
international_travel.answer: Most travelers use 1-3GB per day. Light users (email, maps, messaging) need 0.5-1GB daily. Heavy users (streaming, video calls, social media) may need 3-5GB daily. Use our calculator above to get a personalized estimate based on your specific activities.

apps_most_data.question: Which apps use the most mobile data?
apps_most_data.answer: Video streaming apps (YouTube, Netflix) use 1-3GB per hour. Video calling (Zoom, FaceTime) uses 500MB-1GB per hour. Social media (Instagram, TikTok) uses 100-300MB per hour. Maps and navigation use 5-10MB per hour. Email and messaging use minimal data (1-5MB per hour).

reduce_data_usage.question: How can I reduce my mobile data usage while traveling?
reduce_data_usage.answer: Use Wi-Fi when available, download maps offline, disable auto-play videos, use data compression in browsers, turn off background app refresh, and use messaging apps instead of video calls when possible. Consider using our calculator to estimate your needs before your trip.

average_monthly.question: How many GB does the average person use per month?
average_monthly.answer: The average mobile user consumes 5-10GB per month. However, travelers often use more data due to navigation, translation apps, and staying connected with family. Business travelers may use 10-20GB monthly due to video conferencing and cloud services.

how_long_1gb.question: How long does 1GB of data last?
how_long_1gb.answer: 1GB lasts approximately: 1 hour of HD video streaming, 8-10 hours of social media browsing, 20-30 hours of web browsing, 100+ hours of messaging, or 200+ hours of email. The exact duration depends on your specific usage patterns.

wifi_vs_mobile.question: Do I use mobile data when connected to Wi-Fi?
wifi_vs_mobile.answer: No, when connected to Wi-Fi, your phone uses the Wi-Fi connection instead of mobile data. However, some apps may still use mobile data for background updates. Always check your phone's data usage settings to ensure apps don't use mobile data unnecessarily.

week_long_trip.question: How much data do I need for a week-long trip?
week_long_trip.answer: For a week-long trip: Light users need 3-7GB, moderate users need 7-15GB, and heavy users may need 15-30GB. Consider your planned activities - sightseeing with maps uses less data than streaming videos or video calling family daily.

mb_vs_gb.question: What's the difference between MB and GB?
mb_vs_gb.answer: 1GB = 1,024MB. Mobile data plans are typically measured in GB. For reference: 1GB can handle about 1 hour of HD video, 8 hours of social media, or 20 hours of web browsing. Our calculator shows results in both MB and GB for clarity.

calculator_accuracy.question: How accurate is this data usage calculator?
calculator_accuracy.answer: Our calculator provides estimates based on typical usage patterns. Actual usage may vary due to video quality settings, app updates, background processes, and network conditions. We recommend adding 20-30% buffer to your estimate for safety.

unlimited_for_travel.question: Should I get unlimited data for international travel?
unlimited_for_travel.answer: Unlimited plans are great for heavy users or when you're unsure of your needs. However, they're often more expensive. Use our calculator to estimate your usage first. If you expect to use more than 10GB per week, unlimited plans are usually cost-effective.

video_call_data.question: How much data do video calls use?
video_call_data.answer: Video calls use 500MB-1GB per hour depending on quality. HD video calls use more data than standard quality. Group calls use more data than one-on-one calls. Consider using audio-only calls when possible to save data.

best_esim_plan.question: What's the best eSIM plan for my data usage?
best_esim_plan.answer: Choose a plan that covers your estimated usage with some buffer. Our calculator recommends plans based on your usage. Look for plans that offer good value (price per GB) and cover your destination countries. Consider plans with rollover data if available.
